p: The differences encountered between experts and the public in their knowledge of environmental issues such as forest management and climate change is often identified as one of the main reasons explaining why they have different perceptions of risk [ 55]. However, while some studies do not find significant relationships between knowledge and risk perception [ 56], others even contradict this assumption by showing that higher knowledge can actually reduce risk perception of climate change [ 57, 58] or of forest pest outbreaks [ 59].
